action.action-desc: Mr. Biggs of Arizona (for himself, Mr. Ogles, and Mr. Harris of Maryland) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on the Judiciary, and in addition to the Committee on Homeland Security, for a period to be subsequently determined by the Speaker, in each case for consideration of such provisions as fall within the jurisdiction of the committee concerned

form.official-title: To amend the Homeland Security Act of 2002 to prohibit certain advertising with respect to the Immigration Detention Ombudsman, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the No Funding for Illegal Migrant Billboards Act.

section.header: Prohibition on certain advertising with respect to the Immigration Detention Ombudsman
section.text: Section 405 of the Homeland Security Act of 2002 (6 U.S.C. 205) is amended by adding at the end the following new subsection:

subsection.text: The Secretary may not obligate or expend any funds to advertise to the general public, by billboard or otherwise, the office or functions of the Ombudsman.
